data.title: Contact us
data.author: Department of Cannabis Control
data.excerpt: You have several ways to contact the Department of Cannabis Control.

content.rendered:
Email us

You can send most questions and comments to the Department of Cannabis Control (DCC) main support desk.

Licensees and applicants

Most requested actions

  • Notify DCC of a product recall
  • Request to change or update your license
  • Make an appointment to pay a fee
  • Submit a data package (testing labs)
  • Request to remediate cannabis goods that failed testing
  • File an appeal

Contacts by topic

  • Licensing, including applications and renewals
  • Track and Trace:
    • System technical support
    • Regulatory requirements
  • Testing laboratories, including technical support and test results
  • Equity, including equity applicant assistance and outreach

Contacts for other stakeholders

  • Local governments
  • News media
  • Law enforcement and other state agencies
  • Grant recipients

Submit a complaint

You can submit a complaint about:

  • A cannabis business operating without a license
  • A licensed cannabis business
  • Cannabis goods, including their packaging and labeling
  • Cannabis goods that made you sick

Call us

The best way to reach us is by email. If you’d prefer to talk to us by phone, call 1‑844‑61‑CA‑DCC (1‑844‑612‑2322).

Visit our office

You can visit our offices in Sacramento or Eureka to:

  • Get technical assistance
  • Pay a fee

Our offices are open Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.

You must make an appointment for fee payments. For appointments, email us or call 1‑844‑61‑CA‑DCC (1‑844‑612‑2322).

Sacramento office

2920 Kilgore Road
Rancho Cordova, CA 95670

North Coast regional office

930 Sixth Street
Eureka, CA 95501

Request a speaker

You can request Department of Cannabis Control (DCC) staff to participate in your upcoming event.

Submit a Public Records Act (PRA) request

You can submit a PRA request for documents that DCC has on file.

Before you submit a request, check our license search to see if the information is already available online.

Submit your PRA request by:

  • Emailing us
  • Calling us
  • Sending us mail

Provide details about the records you want. This helps us identify relevant documents.

We may charge a fee for documents that we provide.

What we cannot provide

DCC cannot provide all the information we have on file, including:

  • Open investigations
  • Proprietary business information
  • DCC personnel files
  • Owner’s criminal background information

We may also redact documents to protect information that cannot be disclosed.

What happens after you send a request

We will contact you within 10 days to let you know if we can provide the documents you requested or if we need more time to determine if the documents can be disclosed. If we can provide documents, we’ll tell you about how long it will take to produce them.

It takes us longer to provide documents if you request a large amount or a lot of redactions are needed.

Send us mail

You can send mail to:

PO Box 419106
Rancho Cordova, CA 95741-9106
